intro: Snowdenia polystachya, commonly known as the Welsh mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Wales. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late summer. Snowdenia polystachya thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathland and moorland habitats. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
